title: Developer Tools for idiomatic JavaScript
body:
**Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?**

React Developer Tools ***feature*** request.

**What is the current behavior?**

Consider the following class-based component:

```js
class App extends React.Component {
 render() {
    return e("div", {}, "...");
  }
}
```

Consider the equivalent functional component:
```js
function renderApp() {
  return e("div", {}, "...");
}
```

Consider is common practice name functions with a verb followed by a noun (`doSomething()`).
Consider, most of the time, I'm using React without JSX so I'm not forced to capitalize functional components (e.g. `renderApp()` instead of `RenderApp()`).

Currently, the [React Developer Tools](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/react-developer-tools/fmkadmapgofadopljbjfkapdkoienihi) shows the following tree:

```txt
renderApp
  Context.Provider
    renderList
      renderItem
```

It would be nice if instead, it could hide the lowercase portion `render`.

**What is the expected behavior?**

The tree should look as follows:

```txt
App
  Context.Provider
    List
      Item
```

I propose to strip away `render` from the component name.

Why `render`?

In class-based components, we use the `render()` method so it makes sense to call a functional component `renderComponent()`.

Thank you.
